body.p: If you were given a paralytic drug that blocks skeletal muscle function, your biggest concern would be:

multiple_choice.choice: Your heart would no longer beat.
All motility of your digestive tract would stop.
You would not be able to breathe.
You would not be able to move.

response.feedback: Correct. The biggest concern is an inability to breathe, because the diaphragm, which allows you to breath, is a skeletal muscle.
Incorrect. The heart is composed of cardiac muscle and is not affected by paralytic drugs.
Incorrect. The digestive tract is lined with smooth muscle, which is not affected by paralytic drugs.
Not quite. Although this would occur, it would not be your biggest concern.

part.hint: Paralytic drugs are often administered during general surgery in order to keep the patient from moving, but the patient must be put on a ventilator.
